comments_since_last_sample.body:
I used to be a hard-core wow player. Last played during mists of pandering. I'd say new world is perfect for a beginner... you can play basically how you want up to max level, there is alot of freedom in the weapon and armor builds, and the hard things can be effectively avoided untill you are ready for a challenge.. The community seems a little toxic but that's sort of expected since the endgame has a big draw on pvp. The perk to new world vs say ff or wow. You only gotta buy it once, not a subscription model. Untill the loads of xpacs come out at least.
TLDR: give new world a shot. 40$ for a weekend of mmo goodness is equal to a couple theater visits... so why not?

You’re asking for opinions on MMOs, you’re gonna get a million different opinions. Example, I think Final Fantasy and starting out in that game basically has you running errands whereas a game like WoW puts you directly into combat. My suggestion is to pick one that looks fun and go w it. Pretty much all MMOs today are newb friendly, games like Eve and Ultima Online with high learning curves are pretty much in the past.

If you really want to find a recommendation of what to do, find out what style of player you want to be and what MMO fits that style. With all that being said, if I had the time to be playing a MMO I would be playing Burning Crusade Classic. The best era of World of Warcraft IMO
Definitely not. The game is just a cash grab and lacks in the fun department
Runescape is free and can be played in browser

No, it’s straight up trash and broken. 

Start with FFXIV, it’s the best MMO currently on the market and extremely friendly to new players.
